title: Ticket #3360: condor_status quietly fails when there is clock skew between machines
description:
condor_status will fail when the time on the machine where condor_status is run is a few minutes different that the time at the collector. For instance when the collector's clock is 15:17:43, and the client clock is =15:15:00=(about 3 minutes slow), condor_status will always fail.

condor_status reports this failure as "Access denied" which is misleading.

The collector log will show something like: 

    12/05/12 15:17:43 Got QUERY_STARTD_ADS
    12/05/12 15:17:43 Received an expired query (old by 228s), ignoring

This bug was introduced by #2983, an attempt to discard queries when the client has given up. But the query in this case isn't actually old, and client hasn't given up. The collector needs to use a mechanism to decide that a client has given up that isn't fooled by clock skew.
